DataElement.preferredName: Acetaminophen Administered Agent Use Week Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of times acetaminophen is taken on a weekly basis

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A drug that reduces pain and fever (but not inflammation).  It belongs to the family of drugs called analgesics._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A drug that reduces pain and fever (but not inflammation).  It belongs to the family of drugs called analgesics.

Concepts.definition: A p-aminophenol derivative with analgesic and antipyretic activities. Although the exact mechanism through which acetaminophen exert its effects has yet to be fully determined, acetaminophen may inhibit the nitric oxide (NO) pathway mediated by a variety of neurotransmitter receptors including N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) and substance P, resulting in elevation of the pain threshold. The antipyretic activity may result from inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis and release in the central nervous system (CNS) and prostaglandin-mediated effects on the heat-regulating center in the anterior hypothalamus.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number of an agent formulation (dose, capsule, etc.) used by a person within a week of time.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ReferenceDocuments.name: During this period, on averag
ReferenceDocuments.description: During this period, on average how many times did you take acetaminophen-based medications per week?
